spans.text: Winter has passed, and early spring is gradually opening, with a few rash and sparse warriors sprouting from the trees. Tokyo's cherry blossom season is just around the corner, another cycle of life.
Taki shielded the child behind her, striding forward and opening the door first.
Hiss...!
No, winter hasn't left yet.
Hina, zip up your coat.
Taki Shiina is a dignified teacher, and the little student hurriedly did as she was told.
It's just that the newly manufactured limbs are slightly clumsy, and the zipper teeth make a dull, astringent groan, indicating that the owner of this coat is not yet ready to take care of herself.
In fact, in terms of life skills, Taki Shiina is not much better than her students. But the privilege of adults is that they can suffer for face.
The dignified teacher put her hands in her pockets and pushed open the thick glass embedded in the door frame with her shoulders.

Warm yellow light shone across the street. It was past 5:30, and even the sunset had faded away. A crayon-like blue floated in the sky closest to Taki's vision, while an ink-like blue fell far behind. It's time to go home.
Why don't you go to McDonald's with the teacher?
Little Taki, long time no see.
Soyo-neechan!

Soyo naturally took the child's hand, her eyes seemingly sweeping over Taki's empty neck. The dignified adult suddenly had a creepy feeling of being caught by the teacher for forgetting to write homework.
Little Hina's mother, Ms. Yamada, is my colleague. She still has work to finish, so she asked me to pick up little Hina...
Heh—achoo!
...I didn't expect little Taki to be this child's teacher. That's great, I was a little worried about safety because I was late.
Uh, um.
Ms. Yamada should have sent me a message since she asked someone else to pick up the child.
If I didn't happen to know you, it would be impossible to let a stranger take the child away alone.

Taki Shiina tugged at her collar. The spring chill was palpable, and it was late. Her teammate, whom she hadn't seen for many days after the last failed rehearsal, was holding her student's hand in front of her, and she was not yet prepared to contact members outside of the band.
Early spring still didn't escape the clutches of winter. As soon as Taki opened the training institution's door, a gust of cold wind poured in.
She quickly closed the door. The whirlwind adult finally remembered that there was still a scarf she had brought out in the morning in her bag, so she quickly squatted down and put it on little Hina.
The long-time solitary wolf's technique of tying a scarf for others is extremely clumsy. The thick scarf made an ugly knot around the child's neck, but it was good for wind protection.
Teacher Shiina's scarf is as ugly as my dad's.

Aesthetics are worrying, and the skin is thicker than a wall - Taki Shiina doesn't have any of these two good qualities, so she can only touch the tip of her nose dejectedly, knowing that she is wrong, and silently open the door.

Warm yellow light shone across the street. It was past 5:30, and even the sunset had faded away. A crayon-like blue floated in the sky closest to Taki's vision, while an ink-like blue fell far behind. It's time to go home.
Why don't you go to McDonald's with the teacher?
Little Taki is so thoughtful.
Soyo-neechan!
Soyo naturally took the child's hand, her eyes seemingly sweeping over the child's messy neck. Taki suddenly had a creepy feeling of being caught by the teacher for a terrible handicraft assignment.
Little Hina's mother, Ms. Yamada, is my colleague. She still has work to finish, so she asked me to pick up little Hina...
I didn't expect little Taki to be this child's teacher. That's great, I was a little worried about safety because I was late.
Ms. Yamada should have sent me a message since she asked someone else to pick up the child.
If I didn't happen to know you, it would be impossible to let a stranger take the child away alone.

Taki tugged at her collar. The spring chill was palpable, and it was late. Her teammate, whom she hadn't seen for many days after the last failed rehearsal, was holding her student's hand in front of her, and she was not yet prepared to contact members outside of the band.
In short, she had nothing to say.
Ms. Yamada is still at the company working overtime, and Soyo Nagasaki, who was entrusted with the task, is also late, which shows that she is really busy at work.

The tired companion should not continue to shoulder the burden of starting a conversation, but when the third party's interlude is absent, Taki Shiina and Soyo Nagasaki have never had a one-sided discussion on life topics other than physical health.
Now that the person has been picked up...
Teacher Shiina is right.
...Huh?
Not far away, a familiar Toyota Century was parked, and the white-collar worker led the child over, leaving her only a back view.
Taki suddenly realized that she rarely saw Soyo walking in front.
Is Teacher Shiina going to let a stranger take the child away alone?
After an afternoon of class, little Hina in the back seat had already fallen asleep, and even the adults' conversation had subsided.
The car radio was playing Soyo's own imported playlist. It has to be admitted that this guy has impeccable taste in most things, including music.
The topic interrupted by the little snore slipped out of the ears like music, and no one remembered what they were talking about in the previous sentence, which meant that the content was boring.
But this is how time is spent with trusted people.
...It's terrible.
...Right?
The bassist's words were as silent as her uncarried instrument, and the words were drowned in the ensemble. The drummer couldn't hear clearly.
...What?
Little Taki's skill in tying a scarf is really bad.
Little Taki is going to catch a cold again, right?
